rtega_mnemonic:
権権RS
权权		權power, right, authority
  • modf. 權 → 権; men sitting high 雚 on top of a tree 木: they have a commanding view and thus instate power and authority
  • ⓢ hand 又 ripping out a tree 木: power
heisig_constituent: authority, tree, wood, pegasus, horse, pantomime horse, noon, sign of the horse, turkey
myStory:
табличка которая говорит что я могу стрелять в куропаток

权 табличка которая говорит что я могу ходить

как взаимодействовать 相 Но с помощью подстреленной курицы
koohiiStory1: I have Eric Cartman of the “South Park” animated series, wearing a cop uniform, riding a wooden Pegasus (such as on a funfair), and yelling “RESPECT MY AUTHORITAH!!!”.
koohiiStory2: No one has the authority to tie up a pegasus to a tree!
jp_example_words:
棄権(きけん): abstain from voting, renunciation of a right
権威(けんい): authority, power, influence
権(けん): authority, the right (to do something)
権限(けんげん): power, authority, jurisdiction
権力(けんりょく): power, authority, influence
主権(しゅけん): sovereignty, supremacy, dominion
政権(せいけん): administration, political power
特権(とっけん): privilege, special right
権利(けんり): right, privilege
jp_readingExamples: 権利 (けんり), 権威 (けんい), 人権 (じんけん)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Under the tree lies a turkey with a broken arrow in it. It doesn't have rights like humans, so people can just shoot turkeys with arrows and no one is punished.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine if humans didn't have any rights, like this turkey. People could just gun each other down in the street and no one would be punished for it... oh wait. :/
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: "You have rights, so I won't shoot you like this turkey," says the voice of Ken (けん) the samurai, from above you in the tree.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: He jumps down and picks the turkey up, the broken arrow sticking out of its neck. "Turkeys do not have rights, my friend. Just let this one go."
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the man (𠂉) with the one (一) little bird (隹) in the tree (木) has rights

権字的基本解释

権
quán
古同“权”。

権字的汉语字典释义

[①]［quán］
同“權1”。
《宋元以来俗字谱》：“權”，《列女传》、《古今杂剧》作“権”。按，亦为“權”的日本用简体汉字。

暂无。

[①]［quán］
Same as "right 1".
"Song and Yuan Dynasties": "Quan", "Biography of Women", "Ancient and Modern Zaju" as "権". Press, Japanese also uses simplified Chinese characters for "Quan".

Name meaning

quán
яп. вм. 权
Radicals: 木, 矢, 隹  (tree, arrow, turkey)
Meaning Mnemonic
Under the tree lies a turkey with a broken arrow in it. It doesn't have rights like humans, so people can just shoot turkeys with arrows and no one is punished.
Imagine if humans didn't have any rights, like this turkey. People could just gun each other down in the street and no one would be punished for it... oh wait. :/
Reading Mnemonic
"You have rights, so I won't shoot you like this turkey," says the voice of Ken (けん) the samurai, from above you in the tree.
He jumps down and picks the turkey up, the broken arrow sticking out of its neck. "Turkeys do not have rights, my friend. Just let this one go."
